description: For states using conventions to select candidates. Report covers through 20 days before the convention
Report covers through 20 days before the general election - due 12 days before the election
Report covers through 20 days before the primary- due 12 days before the election
Report covers through 20 days before the run-off- due 12 days before the election
Report covers through 20 days before the special election - due 12 days before the election
Report covers from 19 days before the election through 20 days after - due 30 days after the election
Report covers from 19 days before the election through 20 days after. - due 30 days after the election
Report covers from 19 days before the election through 20 days after. - due 30 days after the election
Report covers from 19 days before the election through 20 days after. - due 30 days after the election
Report covers from 19 days before the election through 20 days after. - due 30 days after the election
Report filed by national party convention and host committees disclosing their convention expenses, due 60 days after the convention
Adjustment of a comprehensive amendment - coverage is variable
Amendment modifying information from two or more original reports - coverage is variable
Covers September - due October 20
Covers October - due November 20
Covers November - due December 20
Covers January - due February 20
Covers February - due March 20
Covers March - due April 20
Covers April - due May 20
Covers May - due June 20
Covers June - due July 20
Covers July - due August 20
Covers August - due September 20

Covers January 1 through June 30 - due July 31 Permissible in non-election years for PACs and party committees normally filing Quarterly reports. (Note that since 2003 campaign committees must file quarterly in all years.)
Covers January 1 through March 31 - due April 15
Covers April 1 through June 30 - due July 15
Covers July 1 through September 30 - due October 15
Final report submitted by a committee - coverage is variable
Covers from the end of the last quarterly or mid-year report through December 31 - due January 31
supplement
Filing of Presidential inaugural committee - due 90 days after the Inauguration

Report of specific contribution of $1,000 or more made to a campaign within 20 days of an election. Alternatively, once a PAC or party or other person has made independent expenditures exceeding $10,000 in a race these and future independent expenditures must be reported. Due within 48 hours of receiving the contribution or public distribution of the independent expenditure. 48 hour timing for independent expenditures applies prior to 20 days before the election.

Within 20 days of an election once a PAC or party or other person has made independent expenditures exceeding $1,000 in a race these and future independent expenditures must be reported. Due within 24 hours of the public distribution of the independent expenditure.
